Game.Core

Class GameState

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game.Core.GameState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GameStateInterface

    public class GameState
extends java.lang.Object
implements GameStateInterface
    GameState holds the current state of the game, the game and the cards being played will alter the state of the game.
    Version:
    1
    Author:
    vikfll-0

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameState

        public GameState(Deck deck,
                 java.util.ArrayList<remotePlayer> activePlayers)
        Create a new GameState from the given parameters. ActiveCard, Winner is set to null, playDirection is currently set to +1 as standard.
        Parameters:
        deck - The deck that the game should use.
        activePlayers - The arraylist of players to participate in the game.

        public remotePlayer getNextPlayer()

      • addDrawCard

        public void addDrawCard(remotePlayer player)
        Draws a card for a player, adds it to the internal players hand and to the transmit log for the server to send to the client. Cards is drawn from the gameStates internal deck.
        Specified by:
        addDrawCard in interface GameStateInterface
        Parameters:
        player - Player that should draw a card from the deck.
